Title: Multiclavula vernalis (Cantharellales) new to Japan
Keywords:
Culture, ITS rDNA, Japanese mycoflora, Subalpine
region
Abstract:
Multiclavula vernalis, a lichenized clavarioid fungus, was
newly recorded in Japan with descriptions and illustrations of fruiting
bodies and the thalli based on specimens collected in Nagano Prefecture.
This report also contains the sequence of ITS rDNA, the result of the
molecular phylogenetic analysis, and the information on the available
culture. Multiclavula vernalis was scattered on Andosols in subalpine
habitats in Japan, and its lichenized thallus was amorphous and composed
of spherical algal cells surrounded by fungal hyphae. The photobiont
seems to be a green alga and contained many vesicles thought to be
lipids.
